strengths: Proficient in calculus, linear algebra, and probability theory
Understands mathematical modeling and optimization techniques
Able to generalize problem-solving techniques across domains
challenges: Occasionally struggles with abstract mathematical proofs
Needs improvement in applying probability to real-world scenarios
Prefers structured approaches over heuristic-based problem solving

learning_preferences: Learns well through worked-out derivations and proofs
Finds research papers and technical articles useful
problem_solving_approach: Breaks problems into known frameworks before solving
Verifies solutions using multiple methods when possible
Prefers rigorous explanations over intuitive reasoning

motivators: Interested in applications of mathematics in AI and physics
Enjoys research-oriented challenges and open-ended problems
demotivators: Dislikes rote memorization without conceptual understanding
Frustrated by problems that lack clear definitions or constraints
Prefers mathematical rigor over approximations when possible

notes: Emily benefits from engaging with theoretical and applied math problems.
Encouraging independent exploration in mathematical proofs is useful.
Applying math concepts to real-world problems enhances understanding.
